decision_conditions: Area 2  Car park, crown lift trees in car parking area by 10 ft and remove dead tree from same location.

The Area 2 is not scheduled as part of the Havering TPO 4/49, therefore permission is not needed to work on the trees identified as Area 2, but this is taken as an notification that work is intended to carry out works within the car park area.

It is recommended that these ten conifers and one malus that stand to the front curtilage of the car park of B & Q, Tangent Link running parallel with the A12, these trees may be felled, as they are showing signs of decay and are all in decline, this area is shown on Havering's TPO plan 4/49 as a black dotted line, identified as group G3.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.

That the ten conifer trees for which consent for removal is granted shall be replaced by 30 Thuja to replace the the felled Conifers to form a replacement line along the front of the Band Q car park and the Malus to be replaced by a heavy standard 14-16 cm with a Malus with in 2m of the original tree, within the first available planting season (November to March) following the removal of the original trees. Failure to plant the replacement trees as required can lead to enforcement action.
THE APPLICANT SHALL NOTIFY THE LOCAL PLANNING AUTHORITY IN WRITING WITHIN TWO MONTHS OF THE PLANTING BEING CARRIED OUT, SO THAT THE REPLACEMENT TREE CAN BE INSPECTED.
In the interests of public amenity and to enable the Council to update its records.
